Pizza is typically made by stretching or rolling dough into a round shape, then topping it with tomato sauce, cheese, meats, vegetables, and herbs. The pizza is then baked in an oven until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted.

Pizza is typically made with a dough base, topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and then other ingredients such as meats, vegetables, and herbs. The pizza is then baked in an oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted.
